meanings.definition: Happening or existing at the same time
meanings.sent1: The dancers moved in an isochronous manner, perfectly synchronized.
meanings.sent2: The meeting started at an isochronous moment for all participants.
meanings.sent3: The isochronous arrival of the guests made the party feel like a well-orchestrated event.
meanings.sent4: The birds chirped isochronously, creating a harmonious melody in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The isochronous beating of the drums set the pace for the entire performance.

meanings.sent1: The clock displayed isochronous intervals between each tick.
meanings.sent2: The metronome provided an isochronous beat for the musicians to follow.
meanings.sent3: The isochronous dripping of the faucet became a soothing rhythm in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The isochronous flickering of the candle flame matched the ticking of the clock.
meanings.sent5: The isochronous waves crashing on the shore created a calming pattern.

meanings.sent1: The isochronous bus schedule ensured timely arrivals and departures.
meanings.sent2: The isochronous pattern of the traffic lights helped regulate the flow of cars.
meanings.sent3: The isochronous chirping of the cricket could be heard every evening.
meanings.sent4: The isochronous flickering of the street lamp gave a sense of security in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The isochronous ringing of the bell signaled the start of each class period.
